intro: Nidularium mangaratibense, commonly known as the Mangaratiba sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in moist, tropical environments, often found in wetlands and swampy areas. Its botanical structure is adapted to waterlogged soils, making it an important component of aquatic ecosystems.
